content.description: Sit start with L hand in the Rubix hueco.  Use the arete and face holds to reach the lip.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start in pockets.  Move up and right on crimps.   Get your feet up and throw for the top.  Avoid the easy jugs to the left to maintain the grade.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: The most obvious line on the Cube.  Sit start in a huge hueco.  Work up sharp, shallow pockets until you can get into a big jug.  Snag the lip and try to mantle.  Much harder than it looks!
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit or stand start, doesn't really matter.  Grab the overhead feature hanging down and work up and out the roof.  You will be grappling for feet (hint: remember the start hold)
content.location: East face of Pipe boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start on the obvious layback flake.  Climb the flake up until it starts trending left, then take pockets to the top.
content.location: East face of Pipe boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start in low hueco.  Work up on pockets to the large underclings.  Snag the top of the boulder and top out.  A decent downclimb for the other problems.
content.location: Painted Boulder. See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Work up the corner with right hand in vertical hueco and left on crimps.  Hard top out.
content.protection: See beta pic in area description.
content.location: Painted Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Going up through the best holds on the face. Very fun movement, kind of big. If you feel something crawl on your hand in that last large jug you aren't the only one...
content.location: Home page shows line details

content.description: Sit start in fist sized hueco.  Work up the arete on more huecos to easy top out.  Also a good downclimb for other problems.
content.location: Left corner of Painted Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Avoiding the excellent left hand crack, climb up the edges and pockets to the lip
content.location: Line info on boulder home page

content.description: Sit start on the Southwest arete.  Work up the arete and then finish with some very balancey and technical moves.
content.location: Southwest corner of Pipe boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Work your way up the right side of a nice arete.  When you reach the apex, pull up and over the top to a nice finish jug and easy top out.  Don't fall! It would hurt to land on that pipe.
content.protection: Pads.  Don't land on the pipe!
content.location: Northwest corner of Pipe boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  There's a single bolt on top of the boulder if you feel like setting up a toprope for the kiddos.  Easily accessed by climbing Holey Arete to the right.  Any route you take up this face is ~Veasy to V0.
content.location: West side of Kid Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  The obvious Northeast corner.  Can be used as the boulder's down climb (as the name suggests), or you can butt slide down the north slab.
content.location: Northeast corner of Pipe boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Work up thin seam, then top out using slopey holds that you wish were better!
content.location: North side of Kid Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Just right of Center Crack on the corner.  Start with a poor right hand and left hand on a crimp.  One move wonder to a jug up high, then topout.
content.location: Painted boulder

content.description: Sit start.  Good, easy fun on a beautifully featured arete.  It's worth climbing just to feel all the holds.  Also the best downclimb for the rock.  Probably most people's first "boulder problem" at Dierkes as it can easily be done in your tennis shoes.
content.location: Southwest corner of Kid Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start under the overhang.  Move up the tricky overhanging face on crimps and pockets that always seem to be facing the wrong way.  Throw to the lip and mantle out.
content.location: East face of Pipe boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: A very fun and unique steep boulder, sit start with a racquetball sized knob for your left and a small knob for your right and reach up right for a cozy sloped edge and then reach left for a bucket and then top out
content.location: This is on Lava Boulder just right of snapper Boulder

content.description: Sit start.  Climb the easy huecos left of Snapper.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description:
this is a great problem to work on your slab climbing and head game as it’s a bit of a committing move for the finish

I start in the huge dish ledge slightly right of what’s drawn on topo and move up using shallow pockets and dime edges for feet,  Avoid using the arete on your right for full value.
content.protection: 1-2 pads will do. be careful topping out.
content.location: Nice dimpled dish on painted boulder see topo for painted boulder.

content.description: Sit start, or whatever.  Stem your way to the top of the boulders.  The easiest way up and down the Cube.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start in the hueco.  Throw to a high hand pocket, work your feet up and top out.
content.location: See beta pic in area description

content.description: Sit start.  Climb the easy face to the top.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: V5 sit start.  V0-V1 stand.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Work up the arete on the SE corner of the Cube.
content.location: See beta pic in area description.

content.description:
very fun jug haul look for obvious huecos.

You have two fairly similar problems  to choose from the right hueco line is maybe slightly harder then the left. You can sit start on lower left of crimp rail and traverse right into either to add length and difficulty.
content.location: These problems are found on French connection just right of Lava boulder

content.description: On painted boulder, climb up and follow the thin crack just right of Center Left v0 (the large obvious path of least resistance).
content.location: Painted boulder, just right of Center Left v0

content.description: Sit start.  Work up slabby, blunt arete using the shallow dimples.  Feels exposed!
content.location: Northwest corner of Kid Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Stand start, although sit variation doesn't look too hard.  Work up crimps to the large, two handed undercling, then dyno to the top.
content.location: Right side of Painted Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

content.description: Sit start.  Climb the southeast arete of Kid Boulder and mantle out the right side (don't finish on Holey Arete).  Be careful you don't stick your hand into the "bat cave" or you will get a nice handful of wet guano.  This feels very exposed; it's a highball by Dierkes standards and you are climbing over a tree and some rocks.  It would be a very nasty fall if you were to slip.  Holds are all there though and a good heelhook will easily help you mantle out over the daunting finish. Fun!
content.location: Southeast corner of Kid Boulder.  See beta pic in area description.

pathTokens: Twin Falls and the Snake River Canyon
